meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>burn</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to burn something</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>to set on fire</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is when you're burning something. To remember this meaning, you have to remember the も part. So, just think of your friend <reading>Mo</reading>e (も), and how you're going to burn him... uh... just a little bit.
